"Monsters, Inc." is a classic computer animated film that was released in 2001.

The movie tells the story of two monsters, Gary and David, who are working at Monsters, Inc., an amusement park where children come to be frightened by the monsters.

As the movie progresses, Gary and David begin to realize that they have become addicted to the fear of the children.

This realization leads to a series of comedic misunderstandings between Gary and David and the other workers at Monsters, Inc.

Overall, "Monsters, Inc." is a classic computer animated film that tells the story of two monsters who are working at an amusement park where children come to be frightened by the monsters.

conversation.text: I would recommend "Kundun", a movie based on the life of Dalai Lama Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong. The movie covers various aspects of his life, including his childhood in Lhasa, his studies at Cambridge University, and his rise to prominence as the leader of the Tibetan Buddhist community. Overall, "Kundun" is a thought-provoking and emotionally resonant movie that offers a unique perspective on the life of Dalai Lama Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong.
